com.statetable.flipflop

Class TwoBitFlipFlop

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.statetable.flipflop.TwoBitFlipFlop
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    FlipFlop
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    JKFlipFlop, RSFlipFlop

    public abstract class TwoBitFlipFlop
extends java.lang.Object
implements FlipFlop
    TwoBitFlipFlop is an interface that holds the JK flip flop and the RS flipflop

    The TwoBitFlipFlop interface is an idealization of this definition in code form. It has 4 methods; namely, setCurrentState: which sets the bit to be stored in the flip-flop, getNextState: which gets the next state according to an implementing flip-flop's "rules" and current state, setFirstBit: which sets the first bit of the flipflop to either 0 or 1, and setSecondBit: which sets the second bit of the flipflop to either 0 or 1.

        public abstract void setCurrentState(int currentState)
        Description copied from interface: FlipFlop
        Sets the current state of this flip-flop to some predefined value. It can only have either of 2 values, binary zero and binary one. {0, 1}>
